title: M’Power Rhythm
text:
Empowering Youth, Building Community, Honoring Culture
M’Power Rhythm is a nonprofit music education organization, formed in 2023, focused on empowering youth, building community, and honoring culture through the medium of ensemble African drumming. We invite youth ages 8-18 from diverse cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds to join us in our joyful and expert-led musical environments and performances.
Group drumming is not only a potent approach to percussion, but also fertile ground for learning teamwork, experiencing belonging, and expressing emotions and creativity.
While playing the rhythms of cultures from throughout the African diaspora, our students develop discipline, confidence and leadership.
Tripp Bratton: Artistic Director and master percussionistLeslie Stamatis: Executive DirectorMeriah Kruse: Consultant

title: Plan Your Gift!
text:
During the course of the Giving Challenge there are certain periods of time during which your gift can be matched by a donor fund.
The funds (described in an Appendix below) differ in how much they will match, in the upper limit on how much they will match any gift, and in their total “pool” of money available to match gifts.
Given the differences between the funds, you are probably wondering:

How and when should I give so as to maximize the amount that M’Power Rhythm receives?

This site aims to help you with your question!

title: Plan Your Gift!
text:
Our Recommendations
Depending on the amount you are giving it may be best to split the gift and give it over multiple days to maximize the matching funds.
We can help you schedule your gift! Just enter the dollar amount you plan to give to see how it can be maximized. (Note: Our recommendations will update automatically.)











Good Advice



Within each time-window, try to give as early as possible, before the fund’s matching-pool is exceeded!


Donate Now

title: Plan Your Gift!
text:
Do-It-Yourself Option
You might have a special interest in engaging with some of the funds or prefer to give on particular days. If you are still interested in maximizing the money we get from your gift—the recommendation we provided in the previous section is usually not a unique solution—then we offer the following advice:

If you are a small-to-moderate donor, you’ll probably be able to generate the maximum gift to us by making just one donation:

Look for a time-window with the highest matching-rate (e.g., $1 for every dollar given is better than $0.50 for every dollar given).
Look also for high maximum matches. For example, suppose you plan to give $150 and you have a choice between two funds, both of which match at the same rate but Fund A does not match gift amounts $100 whereas fund B matches gift amounts up to $200, then you’ll generate more money for us by working with Fund B.)

If you are a “heavy-hitter”, then you should consider splitting your gift over several time-windows in order to leverage multiple matching opportunities.
